dialogueLines: It was a calm evening at the café with blue walls and the smell of cinnamon in the air.
I ordered my favorite hot chocolate again, the one that’s extra sweet.
You smiled and said coffee is always your comfort drink.
The piano was playing softly in the corner, just like always.
We sat near the window seat, the one that catches the evening sunset.
I wore my peach shirt — you noticed and said it suits me.
You looked at the wooden table and said it feels cozy here.
I talked about cinnamon muffins again, you laughed that I never change.
I said, next coffee’s on me — you just smiled.
Before leaving, I said see you soon, and you promised to remember this day.

questions.questionText: What drink did I order that day?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! My favorite hot chocolate — sweet and warm.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not coffee. It was hot chocolate.

questions.questionText: What did you order?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Coffee — your usual comfort.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not tea, you always choose coffee.

questions.questionText: What color were the café walls?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Blue — calm and peaceful.
questions.wrongResponse: No… they were blue, remember?

questions.questionText: What scent filled the café?
questions.correctResponse: Right! The smell of cinnamon — my favorite.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t vanilla, it was cinnamon.

questions.questionText: Where did we sit?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! By the window, watching the sunset.
questions.wrongResponse: No… we sat near the window.

questions.questionText: What was playing in the background?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly. Soft piano — like the café’s heartbeat.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not jazz, it was piano.

questions.questionText: What time of day was it?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Evening — the light was warm and golden.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not morning. It was evening.

questions.questionText: What color was my shirt?
questions.correctResponse: Right! Peach — you said it suits me.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not blue, it was peach.

questions.questionText: What pastry did I mention?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Cinnamon muffins, always.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I never talked about donuts.

questions.questionText: What did I promise before leaving?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said next coffee’s on me.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say call me. I said I’d pay next time.

questions.questionText: What did I say before leaving?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said see you soon.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not bye. I said see you soon.

questions.questionText: What did you say about the table?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! You said it feels cozy here.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you said cozy, not cold.

questions.questionText: What did I wear that day?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! My peach shirt — you remembered.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t wear a jacket.

questions.questionText: What was our dessert that day?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Muffins — again.
questions.wrongResponse: No… we didn’t have cake.

questions.questionText: What kind of conversation did I mention?
questions.correctResponse: Right! I said good conversations are hard to forget.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not boring ones.

questions.questionText: What emotion did I show most that day?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Joy — I couldn’t stop smiling.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I wasn’t sad at all.

questions.questionText: What sound did we hear first?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! The clink of cups — classic café start.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not the bell, the cups.

questions.questionText: What did I call the café atmosphere?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Peaceful — my favorite word for it.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said peaceful, not loud.

questions.questionText: What kind of walls did the café have?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Blue — calming like the sea.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not brown.

questions.questionText: What promise did you make that day?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! You promised to remember this day.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t promise to call, you promised to remember.
